name: The Resort at Pelican Hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. The grounds are lush and mature. I checked in and my room wasn't available but they offered for me to use the spa facilities if I wanted to freshen up or change. I declined and headed to the pool to relax. Service was fantastic and quick with my drink and food. The grounds are spread out but the walk is enjoyable. You park your car next to your room which is convenient. If you need, the hotel offers rides from your room to wherever you need to go. My husband played golf and the hotel drove him over to the course. Our room was very large and well appointed. The spa is fantastic as well as the service.
reviews.title: beautiful resort

reviews.text: My mother and I had a wonderful trip. We arrived earlier than check in time and they had our room ready for us. We were handed an envelope, which included our itinerary during our stay. This included our spa and dinner reservations. Eric took us to our beautiful bungalow in the 'golf' cart and explained the features of the gorgeous room. The Coliseum Grill's and Andrea's service and food was outstanding. Mom and I walked around the pristine property all the while looking out to the blue Pacific. We also took the complimentary coach to nearby Fashion Island, which leaves the resort at the top of the hour. This complimentary coach also picks up from Fashion Island every half hour...extremely convenient and impressive, I thought. The rooms are quiet. The bath amenities are of high quality. You can leave your shampoos and lotions at home. The night before our departure, hospitality service called our room asking if we needed any assistance and they were able to print out our boarding pass and leave it at our door the next morning. Mom didn't want to leave, but we had to via cab, which picked us up right at the steps of our bungalow. The attention to detail was not lost by the service, building and landscaping architects. Amazing. Thanks, to all at The Resort at Pelican Hill, for making our trip memorable.
reviews.title: Wonderful mother and daughter trip

reviews.text: I just got off the phone after calling back 3 times to get through. Once I got through, I asked for front desk. I was placed on hold for 3 mintues and then Alissa picked up and began askingme about my roomdates, etc. After speaking to ehr for another 3 mintues, she said someone form reservations would call me back. I asked her why she said she was "reservations" and she said, "oh no, I amreservations for activites. not rooms." I asked her why I could not be transferred to room reservations and she said they were all in a meeting. It is Monday at 5:45pm and not one single room reservations person is avaialbe to speak to.....I thena sked to speak to teh GM and she told me that isnt possible. I asked to speak to a amanger, and she put me on hold for about 90 secodns and then hung up on me.
reviews.title: No Phone Service-do not stay at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do reviews all the time and have come to the conclusion that phone service in a hotel is 100% indicative of the service you get when you are at the hotel.
reviews.title: Pelican Hill vs The Lodge at Torrey Pines

reviews.text: This hotel is supposed to be "luxury" 5 star and costs over $600 a night.
reviews.title: Stunning property!

reviews.text: Everything about this resort is outstanding -- the grounds, staff, lodging, etc.
reviews.title: Unbelievable perfection - fantastic stay

reviews.text: All of our needs and whims were cared for during the five days we spent in a villa. Can't say enough good things about the staff. The perfect place for a family or friends getaway.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: Just got back from a four-night stay at Pelican Hill and loved every minute of it. Once a year I meet up with four college girlfriends for our annual girls trip. We have stayed at some posh places across the country and Pelican Hill ranks right up there with the best. We stayed in a Villa, which proved to be a fabulous two bedroom suite. The service was impeccable, the pools are fabulous and the spa was top notch. We enjoyed our dinner at the Grill but will say dinner at Andrea was slightly disappointing. Laguna Beach and Newport Beach are quick drives away. Would retrun to Pelican Hill in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: I Was In Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never have I stayed in such a luxurious and tranquil as all the others that I have stayed at before. I must say that I thoroughly enjoyed my every minute of stay in this villa, Pelican Hill Resort. On reaching our destination, I was completely blown away by the lush greenery in the gardens surrounding the villas and the beautifully-furnished and cosy room.
reviews.title: Deserving of #1 resort in the US

reviews.text: Pelican Hill Resort is strategically-located along the coast in Newport Beach and it is a perfect place for you to escape the hustle and bustle of city life. Besides enjoying the state-of-the-art facilities provided, you can take a short walk to the soft sandy beach for a stroll to enjoy the breathtaking scenery or you can take a leisurely walk around the huge landscaped surroundings where you can just enjoy nature’s beauty.
reviews.title: Excellence by the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently went with another couple friend to The Resort at Pelican Hill. We stayed in one of their Villas which was first class. The staff at the whole resort was about as good as I have experienced. Kerry at the Villa pool went above and beyond to make sure we had a good time and even took us out on a boat to see the Harbor. Kevin, the butler was also great and made sure our villa had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we will be back to Pelican Hill!
reviews.title: Superb resort -- but you pay for it

reviews.text: Alex E
reviews.title: Dreamy Couples Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bottom line for Pelican Hill is that it is a wonderful place, but one that is expensive by any standard. If you stay for a few days and are hitting the golf courses, the spa and the restaurants you can run up a bill that approaches the national debt of some countries.
reviews.title: 5 star resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is beautiful and immaculately kept. The extensive landscaping is very well maintained. We stayed in an ocean view bungalow, which was large and had a very nice patio. "Ocean view" is a bit of a misnomer since the resort is a good distance from the Pacific and you really only see the ocean from your bungalow if you stand on your tiptoes and peer over the landscaping. The rooms are nicely appointed with comfortable furnishings and bedding. The bathrooms are spacious with enough water pressure in the shower to knock you over if you're not careful. Service throughout the resort is friendly and very professional.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect.

reviews.text: There are several top-notch resorts in the area; we (my husband, my teenage son and I) had already been at The Ritz-Carlton Laguna Niguel and had wanted to try another one. It proved difficult to find such a place at least if you don’t want to pay exorbitant prices, so we were lucky enough to come across the Pelican Hill. Of course it isn’t a bargain but you get value for money there. The hotel doesn’t lie on the beach but it’s situated in the hills above the Crystal Cove State Park. Nonetheless, you have expansive views of the Pacific Ocean and there is a coach service from resort lobby to Crystal Cove where you get a chair and umbrella set up from the Beachcomber attendants. The grounds of Pelican Hill are vast und pristine. As the hotel didn’t accommodate three persons in a smaller room we opted for the Garden King Suite which is very impressive. There are two large rooms with two spacious bathrooms and a large terrace (with a not so spectacular view on the Coliseum Grill’s front entrance) This suite offers all the luxury you can think of, it’s probably one of the most beautiful accommodations we ever had and we widely travelled! We used neither the spa/fitness room nor the golf course and are therefore unable to comment on these facilities. We twice had breakfast at the Coliseum Grill which was okay but nothing special. Personally, I don’t like the décor of this restaurant, it’s a bit bland but that’s a matter of taste. Once we had dinner at Andrea, the resort’s upscale restaurant, and considered the evening as a good experience (we liked the atmosphere and the food). One comment to the resort’s architecture … All is very Italian, almost a bit too much so it’s overkill but maybe I feel this way because I come from a country bordering Italy. Never mind, a lot of things are nice to look at, e.g. the circular swimming pool, very impressive! As far as staff is concerned, generally speaking we were satisfied with the service although it wasn’t flawless. Several times, employees weren’t attentive enough, but it wasn’t too bad. All in all, the Pelican Hill is a good choice if you are looking for an upscale resort at the Orange Coast offering a nice setting, beautiful views and state of the art facilities, and this without demanding unrealistically high prices.
reviews.title: Nice setting, beautiful views and good facilities

reviews.text: We stay in one of the North Villas. The resort was even more beautiful and luxurious than I'd pictured having read these reviews. The villa was a large 2 bedroom, excellently furnished, and overlooking the ocean. It came with twice daily housecleaning as well as a fully equipped kitchen. Our concierge, Akita, cared for our every need, including recommending fun activities and finding us an emergency dentist on a weekend. Even though it was cold outside, we swam in the pools which were heated to 82 degrees. We had a great yoga class at the spa. This was a very comfortable resort for a family with children as well as groups of adults.
reviews.title: Already planning a return visit

reviews.text: The location is very convenient to activities in the area although it is not right on the beach.
reviews.title: Beautiful, peaceful and quiet

reviews.text: We mostly ate off-resort, but we had drinks by the pool and lunch at the Coliseum grill and I was pleased with everything overall.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.text: Visited in November of 2011 on business. The resort and the rooms are just beautiful. Rather spreadout so you can either take a nice walk , use shuttle bus or possibly the Bentleys they have out front. A few larger business group were having conferences but the resort still felt uncrowded and peaceful. Pool area is lovely but eventhough you have a view of the ocean the beach is a short drive down the hill.
reviews.title: High end resort-without high end prices!
Disappointed from the beginning
reviews.text: We arrived early (11am) as part of a small family gathering (3 families/15 people). I knew our room would probably not be ready but I gave my ID and the young not very friendly female working the desk also swiped my credit card. She asked the usual questions ("what local paper do you want."). Meanwhile the other families checked in. I check at the desk with the same female again after 90 minutes. It is obvious she knows me because she replies my room is not ready. I give her my cell number and wait. Around 3:15 later, I walk up to checkin, after eating lunch. I ask about my room and she says it is ready. But, she wants my ID and credit card. I just walked up from the pool with only my phone. So, I have to walk back to the pool to get my ID AGAIN. I understand you need to verify who people are, but this was absurd. I was not the only one to notice her attitude (I heard another comment in line). When I returned they swiped my card again, looked at my ID and again asked what paper I wanted!

The room we got was for handicapped. I should have called and asked for a change but I did not want to see the desk girl again. My husband (6'2") would not fit in handicap shower. The room was totally different than the others my family had, though they were to be the same. We should have been informed we were getting a handicapped room
reviews.title: Great- if it's your style...

reviews.text: There were many people that worked there that were great (attendants at pool,concierge, housekeeping, valet, etc). And, I had heard so much about this place.... Hugely disappointed
reviews.title: Do I have to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also coffee maker in the room has built in coffee grinder to when I was trying to quietly make coffee the first morning...the noise of the grinder...I am surprised it did not wake the neighbors it was so loud.
reviews.title: The BEST place in the US! A feel of Tuscany!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were good, especially Andrea and piccolo.
reviews.title: Nice room, the worst management team ever

reviews.text: This was a great weekend getaway from LA. It takes less than an hour to get there from Santa Monica but feels like a world away--beautiful views and very serene setting. The service is amazing from the moment you pull up. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. We had brunch at the restaurant by the pool while we waited for our room. The view was beautiful and the food was delicious, though nothing particularly unique. We stayed in the ocean view villa, which was a two room suite--bedroom, living room, two bathrooms and a huge terrace. I really liked that the two areas (bedroom and living room) were separated by a actual door. Our son came with us and it was very easy to put him down for a nap in one of the rooms, shut the door so that he wouldn't be disturbed, and do our own thing. We ordered room service for lunch and they set it up for us on the terrace. Our son was napping while we ate and took in the gorgeous view of the ocean. It was very much an "Ahhh.." moment after a hectic week. There were some interesting photo books about the area in the room, which we read while sunbathing on the terrace.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Getaway from LA--especially with a small child

reviews.text: We also really enjoyed the kids pool. There is obviously the pool itself but there is also a great, big sandbox area with toys. Our one year old son was completely enthralled and played on his own for an hour while we sat back and lounged by the pool/next to the sandbox. If your child is a little older, they have a kids club for kids four and up that is also by this area. I'm not entirely sure what they do there but it looked like fun--lots of toys, ping pong table, crafts, and a few employees to keep the kids entertained.
reviews.title: Like in Heaven

reviews.text: The only con of course is the price. We went for a special occasion so it was worth it this time around.
reviews.title: Beautiful all rounder

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, when I say like in heaven. True there are not many guests. It is just the way you feel - idyllic, special and peaceable. The best way to make vocations- if you have the necessary wherewithal!
reviews.title: Gorgeous with Outstanding Customer Service

reviews.text: We stayed three nights in a 3 bed villa with another family overlooking the golf course and ocean. Unfortunately the smog from LA was always visible as there was little wind over the three days. Apart from that, two beautiful large communal pools and we had room service one night - excellent - and the restaurant another night which was also terrific. We also played golf which was challenging even for our low handicappers. One objection - $8 for a takeaway coffee from the golf cafe one morning - bit excessive! Villa has a well supplied kitchen, large enough lounge and deck overlooking the golf. We would definitely stay again and recommend to other friends.
reviews.title: Outstanding in every way; very impressed

reviews.text: From arrival to departure, everything about my stay was absolutely fantastic and top-of-class. From the valets to the spa, I found service to be bullet-fast, friendly, and thoughtful, and was especially impressed with the number of staffers who addressed me by name....perhaps easier in the low season, but still extremely appreciated.
reviews.title: Easily Proved its 96.0 Rating in the Conde Nast Gold List

reviews.text: I found the property beautifully formed and a breeze to walk between the restaurants, spa, pool, and my bungalow....which is the crowning glory of the resort in my mind. At a minimum of 840 square feet, the amount of space invites relaxation, and the fireplace, great bedding, and enormous bath stocked with upper-end toiletries invite one to luxuriate.
reviews.title: You relax as soon as you arrive!

reviews.text: The casual and upscale restaurants were all excellent, the property absolutely pristine, and the wet areas of the spa perfectly looked after....to the point that discarded towels seldom lasted more than 30 seconds before being picked up and refreshed....and it is rare I see that level of attentiveness.
reviews.title: Horrible service: Staff is unhelpful and chef knows nothing about allergies

reviews.text: Having also stayed at the St. Regis, which is great in its own right, I give my nod to Pelican Hill....primarily for the generous room space and the high degree of personalized service. I hope you enjoy!
reviews.title: Relaxed luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this place. I was in need of rest and pampering after putting down my beautiful 14 year old dog. As soon as I arrived I knew I picked the right place. I stayed in a two bedroom villa that was bigger than my house! The place is grand, but not in a cheesey Las Vegas way, quality construction, furniture, bedding, etc. The service is first-rate, yet casual. I think our butler would have given us the shirt off his back if we asked. Did I mention, whenever you want to go to the beach, golf course, or restaurant, you just call you butler and he is there within minutes to drive you. Also, no extra cost to park, internet, use of spa or fitness facilities which was nice for a change. I miss Pelican Hill so much, I am planning a trip in May!
reviews.title: Nirvana in Orange County

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights, and it's pretty rare I give a hotel all five stars. But this one is comfortable, soft, peaceful, pleasant, thoughtful and really really opulent. We had a bungalow with 20' ceilings, a fireplace, HDTV with a Bose 3/2/1 system. All of the appointments at the desk were thought of, ethernet connection - free WIFI (no sign-in) plugs, an aux cable to hook up your ipod to the bose, great robes, great bath appointments. Nothing was missing. Reading light under the canopy headboard, room switches right next to your nightstand, accurate temperature control - even with the automatic fireplace. These folks really know how to set the place up.
reviews.title: It's Perfect, and Surprising

reviews.text: The only error in our stay, and this was weird, was that the previous guest's food was in our honor bar (yogurt, cold cuts, etc). I alerted the hotel and whisk, it was fixed.
reviews.title: A True 5-Star Resort in OC

reviews.text: Spa - excellent. Quiet, well-appointed, opulent, spectacular, and with an experienced therapist. Grille? Great restaurant.
reviews.title: A Bargain vs. the Montage with nicer rooms and great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a 4 bedroom villa over christmas weekend with extended family (total of 8 people). Our stay was simply magnificent and unforgettable. The villa came stocked with some peligrino water, beer, light breakfast foods, and a few snacks which was a plus. the villa also had free wireless internet.
reviews.title: Perfect 100

reviews.text: the villas were provided with maid service in the morning and again in the evening for turndown service. another plus is if you are going anywhere within the resort, you do not need to drive yourself. the resort offers free shuttle service to any other resort area (beach, golf course, gym, spa, etc.) and all you have to do is call the shuttle and stand outside your villa.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: I stayed at the resort at pelican hill recently on a business trip with Porsche ( who i work for ), I was lucky enough to have my room paid for for a few nights while i paid for a few nights myself as i extended my stay.
reviews.title: Everything you would expect from a resort such as this !!!

reviews.text: I arrived at John Wayne airport and picked up my rental car ( i believe its about a $30 cab ride ), the drive to the resort took about 20 minutes and it was easy to find ( using my GPS :) ), i pulled into the reception area and was checked in in minutes, i was greeted warmly and everyone had a smile and a greeting for me.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: I had a bungalow reserved, which i had one of the employees lead me to it in a golf cart while i followed in my rental car , i was staying in 439 which while offering a great view is a little far away from some of the amenities ( more on that later )
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: My bungalow was a very nice warm place to be, i had a private terrace with a great ocean view, and a nice bathroom with a huge walk in shower, one minor complaint is that while there is a good size fridge in the room it was fully stocked with ( expensive ) sundries and if you want to store anything to keep cool you will have to get creative, i think with all the storage options they offer in the room a little mini fridge to keep your own things cool would be a nice idea.
reviews.title: Worth spoiling yourself!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the room is also a nice flat screen HDTV with an impressive BOSE audio system built in.
reviews.title: The ultimate in style

reviews.text: This place is sprawling and has everything imaginable at your fingertips. Wonderful service, delicious food, gorgeous views and the room is perfect! I loved all of the details, finishes and extreme cleanliness in our villa. Tons of space with over 1000sf. The pool is huge, fun and offers a fantastic view of the Pacific Ocean both day and night. The clientele was seemingly lots of la folks. My family, including 4 teens had a great time too. We can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Expansive and luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the resort grounds are beautiful. The bungalow is well planned out and has all the amenities you would expect for the price of the hotel. The patio’s are very large and fantastic to have a glass of wine with your wife.
reviews.title: Service??

reviews.text: The location is a bit far set back for the true ocean experience but proximity to the golf is perfect. We walked every morning down the hill and down to Carona Del Mar for coffee.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights and played 2 rounds of golf.
reviews.title: Way too expensive and far from Ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The golf was amazing. The courses are well taken care of and having the fore-caddie was a nice experience.
reviews.title: WOW WHAT A RESORT!

reviews.text: We came in with low expectation from our last trip (read my 1st review from last May) but I was still disappointed. We decided to stay here again b/c it's close to disneyland and it's a nice facility to relax (not nice service). We are a family of 4 with a well behave 4 years old and a mellow 7 months old who just want a place to relax after a day of theme parks. We frequent high end hotels regularly (four seasons and Peninsula hotels around the world). We booked our room though our travel agent and paid full price for it ( not hotel and air fare package or Priceline) what we got in return when we checked in at 7pm was an accessible room. When we are paying for a room to relax in a resort it's very disappointing to received a room that doesn't suit our needs. The check in staff never told us this was an accessible room when we checked in and when we called to complain they didn't really understand what the problem was with an accessible room (it's very awkward to move about with 2 young kids in a bathroom that have a higher toilet, open shower that looks like a shower room in a swimming pool). After our complain they changed our room. I don't understand why they didn't give us the regular room the first place so we didn't have to drag 2 tired jet legged kids around after a long day. They by the way did not cry at all or make any noise during all that commotion of moving room during the night.
reviews.title: Disappointed again

reviews.text: They next day I spoke to a manger name Josh about the situation and his response was that the accessible room was part of my room category and it's normal that any guest will get that room. I understand his explanation but I don't' know why they don't inform the guest when they check in so they don't have to find out after they move all the stuff in and have to move again in the middle of the night. He offer to compensate us with a bottle of wine but we declined.
reviews.title: Move over Montage- there is a new King of luxury on the hill.

reviews.text: During our 4 nights stay we only spent a few hours at the pool each day and had pool side service. When I checked out I walked up to the front desk and smiled and a staff name Ryan was writing something down and just pointed his index finger up to indicate to me to wait a minute. NO Smile what so ever. I really don't mind waiting b/c it looked like he was trying write down something before he forgot but when he was finish there was no thanking me for waiting at all. He just said " can I help you" I find his service language very rude. When I checked out with him and told him the 10.00 in room coffee charge was incorrect and his reply was "you didn't drink coffee any of the days?" and when I said "no we don't drink coffee" he then question me again " you don't drink coffee". Not until I reply NO for the 3rd time about the coffee then he finally took it off my bill. I don't understand why he thinks I would try to get out of a 10.00 coffee charge when I have a over 2k room bill. After the bill was all settle he wouldn't even say a "thank for staying with us" and just gave me the bill. I felt like there is no appreciation for their guest. I guess they don't really care for vacation guest at this hotel b/c they have so many corporate accounts guest to fill the rooms. If you are on corporate accounts and staying here it would be easier to look past the faults.
reviews.title: Best resort I've been to
It is awesome!
reviews.text: The bellboy/ doorman thinks they are too good for the job or the guests (maybe b/c we were driving our rental car and not our nice car). They are not very eager to help and lack welcoming smiles.
The only service personal that was outstanding was the concierge staff who help me with my boarding a pass.
reviews.title: A Wonderful First Visit

reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel! With its fantastic, attentive staff, great location, amazing concept & design, its the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Apart from transfer cost issues at checkout, which were resolved very quickly & slow service at breakfast on one of the days (the hotel kindly got rid of that day's charges for breakfast- very nice gesture!) it was amazing! Nothing was too much for them- the best restaurants/ sightseeing, nothing was too much to ask! Go there & you will love it. Its romantic, modern, elegant, great value for money, good for kids & family & above all, it makes you feel like you don't want to leave & want to go back again & again; I certainly will! Ignore all the negative reviews because they were not staying where we were- far from the "rubbish service" etc.. it was paradise & I thoroughly recommend it to anyone for any type of holiday as it caters for all; young & old, solo, couple or family, for having a wedding, for romance, for just about anything, go to Pelican Hill & you will not be disappointed! AMAZING PLACE!
reviews.title: Great Resort. THE best in the world!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had heard of the resort and have visited many wonderful places and this has to rank in my top 5 of all time. We stayed in a villa with no view of the ocean or anything exceptional but were fine with it. We only used the room to recharge for the next day. You can step out of any lodging to a view in no more than 50 steps. Food on the property not awesome but several very nice choices close. Spa was a great experience as well. Two golf courses to rival Pebble Beach.
reviews.title: A GREAT resort at a GREAT location!
This is worth high praise overall!!!!!
reviews.text: Great personnel in massaging, front desk, butlers, and maid staff. Golf was outstanding with nice forecaddies.. Prices have gone up in a recission is very surprising though. From reports about California, they are having there troubles with real estate depreciating and local taxes going up. Orange County is in a world of hurt but this place raises prices!!!!! No criticism...If the demand is there which it should be in a good economy, the hotel should do well. My wife and I were upgraded to a 3 bedroom and were treated like royalty. Thanks again!!!!!!

Stayed at a three bedroom villa for 3 nights on a Family Golf trip. Everything about this place is five star service and attention. Both golf courses, South and North are meticously taken care of and in great condition. Courses are challenging with fantastic views of the OC and the Pacific. Cant beat California weather. Ask for Mike the caddie, you will have a blast with his company and he is very knowledgeable of the courses.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The Villa is about 200 square meters with all the right amenities and top of the line beds, kitchen appliances, furniture, giant bathrooms, etc.
reviews.title: Grand Hotel

description: Pelican Hill® in Newport Coast is an extraordinary Southern California destination with expansive views of the Pacific Ocean. With Palladian-inspired architecture from Northern Italy, the resort offers 204 Bungalow guest rooms and 128 Villas evoking a home-away-from-home feeling, along with world-class restaurants in classic alfresco settings; a luxurious, award-winning spa; 36 holes of golf designed by Tom Fazio; and spectacular Coliseum Pool. Located between the exclusive Laguna Beach and Newport Beach communities, Pelican Hill is currently ranked America's Top Resort by Condé Nast Traveler readers and Grand Resort 2012 by Andrew Harper's Hideaway Report.
